meanings.definition: A line of people or objects forming a barrier.
meanings.sent1: The cordons of chairs separated the two groups.
meanings.sent2: The police set up cordons to control the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The cordons of toys made it hard for the cat to reach its favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: The cordons of books in the library seemed to whisper stories to the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The cordons of colorful flags fluttered in the wind, creating a festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A line of police, soldiers, or guards preventing access to a certain area.
meanings.sent1: The cordons of officers ensured the safety of the event.
meanings.sent2: The military cordons blocked off the restricted zone.
meanings.sent3: The cordons of security personnel made the area feel like a fortress.
meanings.sent4: The cordons of guards stood firm, protecting the entrance.
meanings.sent5: The cordons of police officers guided the flow of traffic smoothly.

meanings.definition: A line of plants or trees used for decoration or to mark a boundary.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful cordons of flowers lined the garden path.
meanings.sent2: The tall cordons of trees provided shade in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cordons of bushes created a natural maze for the children to explore.
meanings.sent4: The cordons of shrubs acted as a living fence around the property.
meanings.sent5: The colorful cordons of plants added a touch of elegance to the landscape.
